datasetPresenter.name: bdiv1802A_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Babesia divergens strain 1802A
datasetPresenter.description: The Babesia divergens 1802A strain was isolated in May 1988 from a cow in the Le Cher department of France with acute babesiosis divergens. Sequencing was performed using the 454 Titanium platform combining reads from a genomic fragment paired-end library with 3 and 8 kb mate-pair libraries and assembled using Newbler v2.6. Sequencing errors were corrected using additional SOLiD v3 reads.

datasetPresenter.name: bmicRI_massSpec_Whole_Blood_Prot_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteome of blood (hamster) stage Babesia microti GI parasites purified with hydrogen affinity nanoparticle technology.
datasetPresenter.description:
Whole blood proteome of Babesia microti GI
Babesia microti GI was propagated in Golden Syrian hamsters according to protocols approved by the ATCC Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee. Blood samples for proteomic studies were collected by peri-orbital route 14 days p.i. and exhibited 30% parasitemia. This included all parasitized RBCs regardless of intra-erythrocytic stage or number of parasites per cell.

Five separate injections of the B. microti-infected hamster blood sample and the uninfected control were analyzed by MS. Tandem mass spectra obtained from this analysis were searched against theoretical spectra derived from an annotated database of protein sequences from B. microti R1 strain (PiroplasmaDB.org) using the SEQUEST algorithm and tryptic cleavage constraints. Peptide hits were combined within the five technical replicates.

datasetPresenter.name: bovaMiyake_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Babesia ovata strain Miyake
datasetPresenter.description: Babesia ovata Miyake strain was sequenced with MinION and PacBio RS II. Reads were assembled with Canu using genome size = 14 m and default settings for the other parameters. Contaminant and redundant sequences were removed and contains were polished using Illumina reads with Pilon with 26 iterations until a plateau was reached. The genome was assembled into 14,453,397 bp in size with 5031 protein-coding sequences (91 contigs and N50 = 2,090,503 bp). Gene models were called using AUGUSTUS version 3.1.0 and supported by RNA sequence (MiSeq RNAseq) data.

datasetPresenter.name: bbigBOND_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Babesia bigemina BOND
datasetPresenter.description:
Babesia bigemina BOND genome sequence and annotation.
The B. bigemina BOND genome was sequenced using capillary technology to 8X coverage and assembled with Phrap. The genome was manually improved in Gap4. Protein-coding genome annotation for B. bigemina BOND was generated by taking a consensus of several ab initio gene prediction programs. Annotation from B. bovis was used to train Augustus, glimmerHMM and SNAP.

For more details, please see the associated publication.

datasetPresenter.name: cfelWinnie_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Cytauxzoon felis Winnie
datasetPresenter.description:
Cytauxzoon felis Winnie Sequence and Annotation:

Genome Sequence and Annotation:
Cytauxzoon felis genomic DNA was purified from leuko-reduced cat blood. The genome was sequenced using a 454 Genome Sequencer FLX with Titanium chemistry and the standard Roche protocol. The sequence was assembled using Newbler 2.0 with a minimum overlap requirement of 90% identity over 30 bases. Resulting contigs were compared to the Felis catus genome and contaminating cat sequences (~2% of total reads) were removed.

Please see the associated publication for details of the assembly and annotation.

Cytauxzoon_felis_life_cycle.jpg

datasetPresenter.name: toriShintoku_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Theileria orientalis Shintoku
datasetPresenter.description:
Theileria orientalis Shintoku is a tick-borne apicomplexan protozoan parasite of cattle. The complete genome sequence of T. orientalis was determined by a combination of whole-genome shotgun and fosmid end sequencing.

Both ends of 40,704 plasmid inserts and 3,840 fosmid clones were sequenced with ABI 3730 (Applied Biosystems) and MegaBACE 4500 (GE Healthcare) sequencers. Contigs were assembled using 111,945 shotgun reads. Gap closing and resequencing of low-quality regions in the assembled data were performed by shotgun sequencing of fosmid clones that covered the target regions, nested deletions, construction of short-insert libraries, and primer walking on selected clones and PCR-amplified DNA fragments.

datasetPresenter.name: tequWA_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Theileria equi WA genome sequence and annotation
datasetPresenter.description: DNA from Theileria equi WA strain was used to construct a small and large insert plasmid library as well as a bacterial artificial chromosome library. A total of 100,835 high quality sequence reads (822 bp average read length, 7X coverage by Sanger methods) were generated and assembled using the Celera Assembler, resulting in 119 scaffolds consisting of 495 contigs. A BAC library was end sequenced to generate an additional 3023 reads which were used to confirm the assembly and for targeted sequencing in the closure phase. Gaps were closed by a combination of primer walking and transposon based or shotgun sequencing of medium insert clones, BAC clones or PCR products.
datasetPresenter.caveat: The original name assigned to this genome, Babesia equi strain WA is incorrect. The name is changed to Theileria equi strain WA.

datasetPresenter.name: bbovT2Bo_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Sequence and annotation for Babesia bovis T2Bo
datasetPresenter.description:
Babesia bovis strain T2Bo is a tick-transmitted parasite of cattle.

A combined sequencing approach consisting of a clone by clone and whole genome shotgun method (8x coverage) was used to generate the complete genome sequence of B. bovis T2Bo strain. There are four chromosomes in this strain (other B. bovis strains have been found to present only three chromosomes in their haploid genomes). The gap closure phase of this sequencing project has resulted in 13 contigs.

This Whole Genome Shotgun project has been deposited at DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank under the project accession AAXT00000000.

Chromosomes 2 and 3 are complete. Chromosome 4 is in three pieces that could not be assembled definitively, but the chromosome is covered. Chromosome 1 has a large gap full of repetitive sequences, and the small contigs are within the gap. The order and orientation of the pieces of chromosome 1 and chromosome 4 are not known.

Additionally, the complete apicoplast genome sequence is available in GenBank under accession AAXT01000007, and the complete mitochondrial genome sequence under GenBank accession EU075182.

The genome sequencing project is a collaboration between Washington State University, the Agricultural Research Service - Animal Disease Research Unit and The Institute for Genomic Research. The complete and annotated nuclear, apicoplast and mitochondrial genome sequence have been published.

datasetPresenter.name: tannAnkara_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Theileria annulata Ankara
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Theileria annulata Ankara, a tick-borne hemoparasite that gives rise to lymphoproliferative disease.

Sequencing:
Piroplasms were isolated from infected blood of Freisian calves. Genomic DNA was purified and sequenced at the Sanger Institute to an 8x coverage using a whole genome shotgun approach.
Annotation:
Annotation was performed using Artemis, genes being identified by manual curation of the output of the gene finding software that included Genefinder (Phil Green, unpublished work) and PHAT (Pretty Handy Annotation Tool, trained on a set of 100 manually curated TA genes.

EuPathDB downloaded the T. annulata Ankara sequence (RefSeq) from GenBank. It is a copy of the T. annulata strain Ankara genome sequence submitted to GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ by the Sanger Institute.

datasetPresenter.name: TannulataAnkara_hssp_dbxref_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
HSSP is a derived database that merges structural and sequence protein information. Proteins from the Protein Data Bank are correlated with sequence homologues which share the same 3D structures. This database contains sequence aligned families as well as implied secondary and tertiary structures.
HSSP (homology-derived structures of proteins) is a derived database merging structural (2D and 3D) and sequence information (1D).

datasetPresenter.name: bmicRI_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Sequence and annotation for Babesia microti R1.
Purified Babesia microti R1 DNA was mechanically sheared into 3 and 10 kb fragments that were subsequently cloned. In addition, a large insert (30 kb) bacterial artificial chromosome library was constructed. Vector DNAs were purified and end-sequenced using dye-terminator chemistry on ABI3730 sequencers. A first assembly was performed using Arachne.
datasetPresenter.usage: Sequence and annotation can be searched based on a variety of parameters such as genomic location, gene ID and BLAST similarity (for a full list of queries see the “Searches using these data” section below). The sequence and annotation can be viewed in GBrowse along with any functional data that maps to it.
datasetPresenter.history: re-annotated, apicoplast genome and annotation added, mitochondrion genome switched to a different isoform

datasetPresenter.name: tparMuguga_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Theileria parva Muguga.
The T. parva Muguga genome was sequenced using a whole genome shotgun approach. A total of 129,000 sequences were obtained from genomic shotgun libraries of the Muguga clone of T. parva prepared in the pHOS1 (2 kbp inserts, 6 fold coverage) and pHOS2 vectors (9 kbp inserts, 2.8 fold coverage).

The sequences were assembled with TIGR Assembler. Gaps were closed by primer walking on plasmid templates or genomic PCR products that spanned the gaps, or by transposon insertion and sequencing of the 9 kbp shotgun clones. About 5,000 end-sequences of a 30 kbp linking library were also generated and used to confirm the final assembly. Gene models were predicted using the GlimmerM and phat gene finders that had been trained on two sets of partial or full-length gene sequences.

The reference sequence (RefSeq) genome assembly for T. parva strain Muguga is provided by NCBI and based on sequence, assembly and annotation submitted by The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR)

datasetPresenter.name: bbovT2Bo_microarrayExpression_lau_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcript Profiling Attenuated vs. Virulent strain
datasetPresenter.summary: Expression profiling of attenuated and virulent strains of Babesia bovis using whole genome microarray.
datasetPresenter.description:
Comparison of the global transcriptomes of a Babesia bovis T2Bo strain pair, one virulent and one attenuated strain.

Samples:
Biological replicate (BR) sample pairs were prepared for transcriptomic analyses. For the generation of BR samples, animals were inoculated with 1 x 10^7 parasitized erythrocytes. When clinical symptoms associated with acute babesiosis were observed and blood smears detected parasitemia, infected blood was collected to establish short-term (<30 days) culture to obtain sufficient starting material. This ensured the original phenotypes were maintained post cultivation.

Microarray:
RNA from each sample was converted to cRNA, labeled with dye and hybridized to custom arrays 3 x 20 B. bovis (Bb) MYcroarrays.

templateInjector.prop:
(exprn_val) left - normalized expression value.
(percentile) Ranking percentile of intensity, relative to all other genes.

datasetPresenter.name: tannAnkara_massSpec_dobbelaere_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Total schizont proteome of T. annulata Ankara purified from infected macrophage.
datasetPresenter.description:
Theileria annulata Ankara schizonts were purified from infected macrophage and whole parasite lysates were analyzed by 1DE, LC-MS/MS. Resulting spectra were searched (Mascot) against the T. annulata and Bos taurus annotated proteins, identifying 645 proteins.

NOTE: The samples shown represent results from different technical protocols and replicated runs which is different from how the data is grouped in the manuscript. These do not provide additional biological insights to the expressed proteome.

datasetPresenter.name: tannAnkara_massSpec_wiens_schizont_phosphoproteins_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Total and phosphoproteomes of T. annulata Ankara schizonts that were purified from the schizont-infected TaC12 cells blocked in S-phase and mitosis.
datasetPresenter.description:
Label free mass specrometry analysis of protein samples (total and phospho-enriched) prepared from Theileria annulata Ankara schizonts that were purified from the schizont-infected TaC12 cells blocked in S-phase and mitosis.

Samples:
Schizont phosphoproteome
Schizont total proteome

Comparing PiroplasmaDB dataset to author publication:
This dataset is parsed at a lower stringency in PiroplasmaDB than was used for the associated PLOS ONE publication (link below). All proteins with identified peptides were included in the PiroplasmaDB analysis, whereas proteins with only one identified peptide were removed from the analysis used for the publication. This results in a greater number of proteins (genes) in the dataset as it appears in PiroplasmaDB.

Increasing stringency on PiroplasmaDB search:
The search parameter "Minimum Number of Unique Peptide Sequences" can effectively remove genes that have only a single aligned peptide. Setting the parameter value to 2 or greater will return genes with 2 or more aligned peptides. This will increase the stringency of the search to the level used in the PLOS ONE publication and increase the confidence that genes returned by the search are expressed at the protein level.

link.text: Proteome Exchange record for this dataset

datasetPresenter.name: bmicRI_HTS_SNP_Genetic_Diversity_HTS_SNP_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Aligned Genomic Sequence Reads - 42 global isolates from human, tick and rodent
datasetPresenter.summary: Whole genome re-sequencing of B. microti isolates from human, rodent and tick. Data were used to determine SNPs against the B. microti RI reference.
datasetPresenter.description:
The complete genomes of 42 Babesia microti isolates, including 32 human cases, two samples from ticks and four from rodents were sequenced. Geographic location of sample origins include Northeastern USA, Midwestern USA, Alaska, Russia and Japan. The 6.4 Mb genome was sequenced to a mean depth of 153-fold on Illumina HiSeq instruments using a paired-end protocol. The data were used to calculate SNPs against the B microti reference genome.

Data were used to determine single nucleotide polymorphisms against the B. microti RI reference.

link.text: Data location: NCBI Bioproject home page

datasetPresenter.name: tparMuguga_DaSilva_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Transciptome of Theileria parva Muguga schizont stage determined by strand-specific paired end Illumina sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description: Transciptome of Theileria parva Muguga schizont stage determined by strand-specific paired end Illumina sequencing.
